[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Empty aggregation] What happens if Signature::aggregate() is called with an empty vector of signatures? Does it produce a valid-looking signature that could pass verification, enabling forgery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Duplicate signature aggregation] Can an attacker provide duplicate signature shares in Signature::aggregate(), causing the aggregated signature to have different mathematical properties that enable forgery or verification bypass? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Aggregation order dependency] Does the order of signatures in Signature::aggregate() affect the final result, and if so, can an attacker exploit this to create different valid multisignatures for the same set of signers? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Verification bypass] In Signature::verify_arbitrary_msg(), can an attacker craft a signature and message pair that passes verification without knowledge of the private key due to weak pairing checks or missing subgroup validation? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Aggregate verification bypass] In Signature::verify_aggregate_arbitrary_msg(), if the messages or public keys arrays have mismatched lengths, can this cause verification to pass incorrectly or enable array indexing vulnerabilities? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Zero-length message] Can Signature::verify() correctly handle zero-length messages, or does hashing empty input create special cases that enable signature forgery? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Malformed message serialization] If signing_message() produces malformed or non-deterministic output for certain message types, can an attacker create two different objects that produce the same signature, enabling signature reuse? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Batch verification attack] When verifying multiple signature shares individually instead of using batch verification, are there timing or ordering vulnerabilities that allow malicious shares to pass? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [verify() vs verify_arbitrary_msg()] Can an attacker exploit differences between Signature::verify() and verify_arbitrary_msg() to create signatures that verify under one method but not the other, bypassing security checks? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Aggregate verification message duplication] In verify_aggregate_arbitrary_msg(), if multiple signers sign the same message (multisignature case), does verification handle this correctly or could message duplication enable forgery? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_sigs] [Public key ordering in aggregate] Does verify_aggregate() assume a specific ordering of public keys relative to messages, and can attackers exploit mismatched orderings to verify signatures under wrong keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Genesis key security] Is the PrivateKey::genesis() implementation deterministic and known, making it unsuitable for production use? Can attackers identify validators using genesis keys and compromise them? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/bls12381/mod.rs] [Module: bls12381_keys] [Private key serialization] When PrivateKey::to_bytes() serializes a private key, is the format secure against side-channel attacks or could timing/memory analysis leak key material? (Medium)
